summary: All five previously-blocking issues were addressed with concrete, testable acceptance criteria and the updated task dependencies remove the earlier sequencing/verification gaps.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Version pin immutability mismatch between Task 1.1 and Success Criteria #1 (ranges not immutable; DIST_HASH reproducibility risk)
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.1 AC now explicitly requires an exact pin (no ^/~), lockfile update, and clean reinstall DIST_HASH reproducibility; Success Criteria #1 was updated to match. This satisfies the supply-chain determinism intent.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: NativeEnforcement re-export planned in 1.4 but not included in 1.2 export verification gate (could export non-existent/type-only symbol)
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.2 now includes explicit verification for NativeEnforcement with a type-only note and a rule to keep type-only items out of contract.json. The added export mapping table artifact also prevents future ambiguity.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 2.2 (bundle hash recomputation) lacked explicit dependency on Task 2.1 though both edit contract.json (merge/overwrite risk)
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 2.2 now depends on 2.1 and includes an AC requiring validate.mjs to pass after both changes in the final contract.json state, which closes the sequencing/consistency gap.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 2.4 identity check was underspecified (how to assert identity; runtime vs type-only; duplicate module instance risk)
previous_issues_status.notes: Layer 1 now specifies reference-equality assertions with explicit import paths, adds a negative assertion against the governance subpath schema, and adds a single-resolved-copy precondition (pnpm dedup). The fallback to Layer 2 if schema is type-only is a reasonable, non-blocking contingency.

previous_issues_status.original_issue: Task 1.3 lacked a concrete constraint on what must be barrel-exported vs contract-listed, risking non-aliased governance exports and collisions
previous_issues_status.notes: Task 1.3 now explicitly forbids unaliased governance TaskType/ReputationEvent exports and uses the Task 1.2 export mapping table as the authoritative source for barrel vs contract actions, which makes the governance surface controllable and reviewable.
